pr_title: [API][Core - Types/Avro][Parquet] Add a precondition null check for the constructor arg of PruneColumns

timeline.message: Adds a not null check for the constructor argument of PruneColumns

timeline.bodyText: Rather than just using the name of the variable, I think this should give more context to users when it happens. "Field id set" or "Selected field ids" would be better.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
I agree with you on this. I was following what I thought was somewhat of a convention - what I should really refer to as something I've seen previously in the code base - of using the argument name directly. However, I also just today saw some instances that are definitely much more explicit.
I will update to be Selected field ids as its inline with our definitions of Select and Project as well as it still contains the argument name in it. Please correct me if I'm incorrect about select vs project. @rdblue
replies.author: kbendick

timeline.message: Use more explicit language in message of added precondition check
Adds precondition checks to more classs named PruneColumns with same patterns using null

timeline.bodyText: I will also check if nameMapping needs a precondition null check.
timeline.author: kbendick

timeline.message: Adds in missing import for Preconditions
